result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L Deridder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.    No possession or use of mind altering substances, or illicit substances without a valid prescription.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: SENTENCE WILL BE FOR TIME SERVED.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

DE has credit for 107 days served.  Court will order 4 months jail, sentence will be for time served. JU for  Review hearing scheduled for June 13, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 25, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Matthew L Deridder in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Defendant Matthew L Deridder in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM107, 15CM117, 15CM125, 15CM143.   Init app in 15CM125-waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to all charges.  Court will modify cash bond to $1000.00. DE may not be present anywhere alcohol is available.  Do not operate a MV w/o a valid operating privilege, all other conditions will remian.
